pageContext.claim: “For example, according to E-Health, the average lowest premium for an Obamacare plan for a 40-year old woman is about $4,200 per year. By contrast, the average lowest premium for short-term coverage for this individual is about $1,300 a year -- a savings of $3,000. And I would say most people would say it would be better.”
pageContext.analysis: They might consider it a better deal from a cost perspective. But Trump is comparing apples and oranges. The short-term plan may not cover doctors visits, hospitalization for pre-existing conditions, maternity care and prescription drugs.
